title: Poupille 2011  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
description: This wine, from selected vineyards owned by the Carrille family, is rich and now mature. Its tannins are merging with the secondary flavors of the fruit as it softens and develops a spice and tobacco character. Drink this wine now.

title: Savage Grace 2016 Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Franc Rosé (Yakima Valley)
description: The first rosé from this winery is a direct press with a several hours of skin contact, coming from new plantings at this esteemed vineyard. Pale cherry in color, it brings pleasing aromas of strawberry, citrus zest, green pepper and mineral. The palate is dry, sleek and stylish, with abundant, tart citrus-rind flavors that keep the interest high, finishing with a green herbal note.

title: Wölffer 2016 Summer in a Bottle White (Long Island)
description: Exuberant rose, lychee and orange blossom perfume abounds on the nose of this light-bodied white blend. Just a shade off dry on the palate, its sun-kissed peach and citrus flavors are plush and concentrated. Zesty acidity and a crush of minerals revitalize the finish.

title: Y Rousseau 2016 Rosé of Tannat (Solano County)
description: This solidly built, dry wine made from the unusual Tannat variety has mild apple and cherry flavors and great balance. Its texture is firm due to good acidity and a touch of tannin, which makes it versatile with foods from pho to barbecue.

title: Viberti 2011 San Pietro Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Stewed prune and cake spice aromas lead the nose along with a balsamic note. Showing the intense heat of the vintage, the warm palate offers dried cherry, raisin, powdered sage and a hint of clove alongside polished tannins. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.

title: Weszeli 2016 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: Green-pear peel and a slight touch of bright lemon make for an understated, slender Grüner. The inherent, herbal freshness appears on the palate, with a hint of white pepper amid clean lemon notes.

title: Arnaldo Rivera 2013 Bussia  (Barolo)
description: Forest floor, new leather, tobacco and crushed herb aromas emerge in the glass. It's youthfully austere and a bit lean, with sour cherry, pomegranate, sage and white pepper framed in vibrant acidity and assertive fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023–2035.

title: Château Loumelat 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
description: This wine comes from a small estate in Blaye whose origins go back to the 18th century. The wine is still young with some lean fruit that needs to fill out the structure—a structure that is all there with firm tannins and a dry core. Drink this firm wine from 2019.

title: Contino 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Gritty, herbal berry aromas smell much like asphalt. Following the nose, this is tight and raw in feel. Burnt, herbal, gritty plum flavors finish clipped and drawing, with pinching tannins and dark spice notes.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2014 Two Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Luscious aromas of red-cherry pie, vanilla, concentrated rose petals, juniper and cocoa show on the complex nose of this wine, of which 75% comes from the Finley Vineyard and 25% from George's Vineyard. The palate's core of dark cranberry and plum is lifted by pepper spice, oregano and marjoram, extending into the finish thanks to a strong tannic frame and well-integrated acidity.

title: Castoro Cellars 2015 Whale Rock Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: This Chardonnay starts with an intriguing combination of light and refreshing aromas that range from walnut to lemongrass and Asian pear. It remains restrained on the palate, with blistered almond, Meyer lemon and flinty flavors, served atop a slow-rising acidity.

title: Chacewater 2016 Windrem Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: This is a nicely dry, fresh and restrained wine. Its best attributes are lightly fruity aromas, white-pepper and wet-stone flavors and a tangy mouthfeel, with a good snap of astringency.

title: Château Bousquette 2013 Tradition Red (Saint-Chinian)
description: Made from organically grown grapes, this blend of 30% Syrah, 30% Mourvèdre, 30% Grenache and 10% Carignan boasts a pleasant balance of ripe black-fruit tones and earthy, herbal hints of garrigue. Hints of violet and lightly toasted oak add depth and interest throughout, with a lush, fruity finish of blackberry and boysenberry.

title: Château Cormeil-Figeac 2014 Cuvée Haut-Cormeil  (Saint-Émilion)
description: The Figeac sector of Saint-Emilion has many estates that split off in the 19th century from a grand Château Figeac estate. This Moreaud family wine is smooth, with the fruitiness typical of the vintage and with a gentle layer of tannins to hold it all together. It will age quickly and should be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Château Coulon 2016 Made With Organic Grapes Rosé (Corbières)
description: A gorgeous, well-balanced wine, this organic rosé opens with attractive garrigue notes that frame the brambly cherry, raspberry and peach fruit core. Medium-minus in weight, the palate boasts ripe fruit tones that settle on a touch of white chocolate richness on the finish, though with good cut to keep the decadence in check. Drink now.

title: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2015 Bruignac Premium  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This is a structured wine that is full of tannins. Its fruitiness is masked at this stage, although it is certainly there. Fine black fruits are edged with the structure and finished with the ripe aftertaste. Drink from 2019.

title: Bargetto 2015 Regan Vineyards Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Fairly sweet aromas of marzipan, honeysuckle, candied apricot and honeyed orange slices show on the nose of this bottling from a longtime winegrowing family in the Watsonville area. It's much tighter and brighter on the sip, with flavors of slightly sour green-pear skins and poached apple, and a touch of caramel on the finish.

title: Batasiolo 2013  Barolo
description: Red berry, underbrush, crushed herb and a whiff of porcini mushroom aromas lead the way. Linear and rather straightforward, the palate offers juicy sour cherry, cranberry and clove alongside polished tannins. It won't take years to come around. Drink 2019–2025.

title: Stevens 2014 Sevens424 Red (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (39%), Cabernet Franc (29%), Merlot (19%), Malbec (9%) and Petit Verdot. It explores the first two varieties's leafier sides, with aromas of garden herbs followed by graphite, orange peel and barrel spice. The palate is tart and fresh, full of cranberry flavors supported by lightly chewy tannins. It brings a pleasing sense of acidity that bodes well for its longevity.

title: Stevens 2014 StevensMerlot Merlot (Yakima Valley)
description: The aromas are bright, with notes of fresh herb, red cherry, Red Vines, orange peel and barrel spice. The palate shows a pleasing sense of concentration and richness, with light meaty notes on the finish.

title: Sparkman 2014 Holler Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Red Mountain fruit from Obelisco, Kiona and Klipsun vineyards make up the heart of this wine, with Dionysus, Olsen and Oasis rounding it out. High-toned aromas of vanilla, herb and jammy black cherry lead to polished dark-fruit flavors. It brings a lot of enjoyment.

title: Tamarack Cellars 2015 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas pop on this 100% varietal, with notes of dark plum, mountain blueberry, vanilla and cream. The flavors are smooth and sultry, mixing fruit and barrel with a plush feel and a lightly astringent finish. The variety is hard to get but it delivers a lot of enjoyment.

title: Tangent 2015 Paragon Vineyard Albariño (Edna Valley)
description: Very pithy aromas of grapefruit, squeezed lemon, crisp Asian pear and a touch of chalk show on the nose of this bottling, another strong argument about how well this variety can do in cool coastal California. The flavors are light and crisp, with yellow apple and yellow-grapefruit pith most prominent.

title: Tenshen 2015 White (Central Coast)
description: Expertly light touches of banana, honey, pecan, tuberose and citrus peel show on the nose of this blend by Joey Tensley and Alex Guarachi. There is great energy and tension to the sip, with yellow-grapefruit-juice flavors. Crisp, this would be a great shellfish pairing.

title: Nasiakos 2015 White (Mantinia)
description: Jasmine, spice and honey on the nose lead to a balance of lemon zest, mandarin orange and fresh fruit on the palate. The wine has a good balance and a zesty finish.

title: Pazo Pondal 2015 Godello (Bierzo)
description: This Godello feels composed and solid. Dry white-fruit aromas are reticent and oily. Flavors of peach and golden apple finish with stability and a sense of class. Drink now.

title: Rust en Vrede 2014 Cape Winemakers Guild CWG Auction Estate Red (Stellenbosch)
description: Winemaker: Coenie Snyman. A blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Syrah, 5% Merlot and 5% Petit Verdot, this opens with bright red-fruit aromas, pronounced in waves of cherry, plum and tea rose. The smooth palate boasts medium yet fine tannins, with ample acidity that complements the juicy red-fruit flavors. Drink now–2021.
designation: Cape Winemakers Guild CWG Auction Estate

title: Kontos 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The smoke, herb, vanilla, wood spice and black cherry aromas are barrel forward but still provide appeal. The flavors are medium bodied, bringing a bit of grittiness to the tannins while finishing green.

title: Laurent Miquel 2013 L'Artisan Syrah-Grenache (Saint-Chinian)
description: Made from 80% Syrah and 20% Grenache, this starts off a touch closed and quiet, but with time reveals notes of black plum, blackberry, licorice, chicory, black pepper and leather. It is strongly textured, with firm tannins and black fruit-skin flavors that linger through the finish. Drink 2018–2021.

title: Les Vignerons de Tavel 2016 Les Lauzeraies  (Tavel)
description: This wine shows hints of tar or rubber when first poured, so decant it for best effect. Once past those, berry and citrus aromas and flavors emerge, lingering on the long, mocha-tinged finish.
